personId.description: If the person ID is `-1`, that means, no person but the system itself has logged that message.

weekday.description: Week day when group meetings take place.

maxMemberCount.description: Maximum number of members until the group is considered as full.

name.description: Name of the group, e.g. to be displayed as title.

requestedWaitinglistPlacesCount.description: Number of member requests with waiting list position

signUpConditions.description: Specifies conditions required to sign up in this group. Not all conditions apply to any user, e.g. some of the conditions only apply to users that are not logged in.

canContactLeader.description: If false, none of the group's leaders have an email address set. Only persons already signed in can sign up.

endDateNotPassed.description: If false, the group's end date has passed and nobody can sign up.

groupHasLeader.description: If false, no leader is set for the group and nobody can sign up.

groupIsActive.description: If false, the group is not in active state and nobody can sign up.

groupIsNotFull.description: If false, the group's max number of members is reached and nobody can sign up.

groupIsNotHidden.description: If false, the group is set to hidden and nobody can sign up.

groupIsOpenForMembers.description: If false, the group is not set to be open for members and nobody can sign up.

groupIsPublic.description: If false, the group is not public and only users already signed in are allowed to sign up.

newPersonDepartmentIsSet.description: If false, the default department for new users is not set. When persons without an account attempt to sign up, no new user accounts will be created but the group leader will be requested by mail.

newPersonStationIsSet.description: If false, the default station for new users is not set. When persons without an account attempt to sign up, no new user accounts will be created but the group leader will be requested by mail.

newPersonStatusIsSet.description: If false, the default status for new users is not set. When persons without an account attempt to sign up, no new user accounts will be created but the group leader will be requested by mail.

rolesSetInGroup.description: If false, the standard role and requester role are not set for the group and nobody can sign up.

signUpHeadline.description: Text which can be displayed as a headline for the sign up section

signUpPersons.description: Lists all persons the current user is allowed to sign up for. This includes spouses, children below the age of 16 and all persons with the same email address.

status.description: Specifies whether this person is already in the group (IN_GROUP), in pending state for the group (REQUESTED), or selected by the user to be added into the group (CLICKED). Otherwise NOT_CLICKED.

info.description:
The ChurchTools REST API is the best entry point for developers to access ChurchTools.

**Authentication:** You need to be authorized to use some endpoints. Those endpoints are marked by a gray lock symbol. If you view the documentation, while you are logged into ChurchTools, all requests are already authorized. If you want to authorized a request, you need to provide a `Login Token` as `Authorization` header in the format `Authorization: Login` or send a valid cookie. You can use the green "Authorize" dialog to enter those details and see how a request would look like in detail.

**Missing Endpoints:** Not all features are yet available by our new REST API. This documentation will grow in the future. We are working hard to add new endpoints with every ChurchTools version. The documentation will always show only those endpoints you can use with your ChurchTools installation.
info.title: ChurchTools REST API

post.description: An agenda can be sent to multiple people at once. Recipients can be participants of one of the events, whereby the user sending the mail MUST see the service groups, or the user can add additional recipients from the list of people the user can see. To send a mail the user MUST see the agenda.

patch.description: Batch API for Transactions. The batch API needs two informations sets. Firstly the `changeset`, which holds the information for the batch command. Either a field that needs to be updated or a trigger keyword to start a command. Secondly, a set of `filters`. Filters are either transaction filters, which resolve to a list of transaction IDs, or you can explicitly state a list of IDs to include or exclude from the batch command.

isImmutable.description: Make All Provided Transactions (explicit or via filters) Immutable.

accountIds.description: Filter by account/contra account. All transactions match, where either account or contra account is in the list.

isIncome.description: Filter transactions by income or outcome transactions. An account group has a flag `cash asset account` to indicate accounts for income/outcome.

exclude.description: List of Transaction IDs. All Transactions except this list of IDs are updated in the given Accouting Period.

affectedRows.description: Number of affected rows, which could be resolved by given filters.

changedRows.description: Number of database rows, which were changed.

get.description:
This endpoint returns a set of all permissions grouped by modulename for the current user. Use this endpoint to check if the user has a specific permission set or is allowed to perform an action based on global permissions.

If a module is deactivated its permissions are not returned by the API.
get.summary: All Permissions for the Current User

get.description:
Group internal permissions can affect different entities in ChurchTools such as `Group`. This endpoint calculates the result of all group internal permissions with regard to a group. That means, the response is the result for the current user, to find out if s/he can do certain actions based on group internal permissions.

Example: The API response has `+add person: true`. This means, the current user can add persons to this group based on this group internal permissions on that group or superior groups through inheritance.

Group internal permissions can affect different entities in ChurchTools such as `Person`. This endpoint calculates the result of all group internal permissions with regard to a person. That mean, the response is the result for the current user, to find out if s/he can do certain actions based on group internal permissions.

Example: The API response has `+invite persons: true`. This means, the current user can invite the person with `{personId}` to ChurchTools based on this group internal permissions. That could mean, the user can the person are in the same group or the user is in an superior groups, which inherits permissions.

get.description:
This endpoint returns Birthdays within a specific time interval. The returned objects are ordered by MONTH-DAY, where the first birthday in the list, is the one next from the start date.

The API also returns the `age` of the birthday. That age is calculated based on the time interval. That means, it is not the current age and also not the next birthday, but the age, which the person had/will have with the end of the time interval.


The time intervall (`start_date`, `end_date`) may not be large than one year.

get.summary: Get information to compare two person records in order to prepare a  merge

patch.description:
**Caution:** This API is published as Beta and subject to be changed. It is published such that customers can play evaluate it with production data.

Generally, you can provide any person field to save, but be aware that write access to the provided ields is required. Beware, that not all fields which are listed in the Person schema can be updated. E.g. `imageUrl` or `familyUrl` 
(see `PATCH /api/person/{id}`)

* using PATCH you can perform the eventual merge, it will
  + patch the person record 
  + replace the personId of the doublette with the Original in all related records.
    * Group memberships
    * Person relation
    * Bookings
    * Wiki-Entries
    * Financial transactions
    * ...
* delete the doublette if `deleteDuplicate` is true

all to be done within one transaction.

get.description: When granted a sign up token, this endpoint returns all fields to display a sign up form for the user.

parameters.description: Group ID of the public group
parameters.name: groupId

parameters.description: The name for which the signup should be made
parameters.name: personId

email.description: If the user is not yet signed in, this specifies the email address the user has provided.

default.description: The default value set when the user does not set this value.

fieldTypeCode.description: One of: checkbox, date, multiselect, number, radioselect, select, text, textarea

id.description: ID of the form field. Only IDs within the same form field type are unique, i.e. a form field is identified by its type and its ID.

label.description: A human readable label for the form field.

madatory.description: If this is true, the field is required.

name.description: The field's internal name. Not intended to be displayed.

options.description: Provides the set of allowed options for select fields.

sortKey.description: Form fields should be sorted by this key ascending.

type.description: One of: "person" (person fields), "custom" (custom group member fields), "relation" (when new family members should be signed up, can be "spouse" or "child"), "comment" (general comment field), "privacy" (privacy agreement for new users)

group.description: Information about a public group, e.g. to be displayed on a group homepage.

allowWaitinglist.description: If true, group sign is allowed even if group is full.

autoAccept.description: If true, group sign up requests will be accepted automatically.

canSignUp.description: Indicates if the current user (either logged in or not) can sign up. This summarizes the information in signUpConditions.

children.description: Lists all (direct) child group IDs for the current group.

currentMemberCount.description: Current number of members in the group.

ageGroups.description: List of target age groups for this group.

campus.description: The campus this group is assigned to.

groupCategory.description: Group category set for the group.

groupPlaces.description: List of the group's meeting places. Only returned if the group homepage is set to display a map.

imageUrl.description: URL to a group image if provided.

leader.description: List of person objects of all group leaders if the group is set to display leaders.

meetingTime.description: Free text field when group meetings take place.

weekday.description: Week day when group meetings take place.

maxMemberCount.description: Maximum number of members until the group is considered as full.

name.description: Name of the group, e.g. to be displayed as title.

requestedWaitinglistPlacesCount.description: Number of member requests with waiting list position

signUpConditions.description: Specifies conditions required to sign up in this group. Not all conditions apply to any user, e.g. some of the conditions only apply to users that are not logged in.

canContactLeader.description: If false, none of the group's leaders have an email address set. Only persons already signed in can sign up.

endDateNotPassed.description: If false, the group's end date has passed and nobody can sign up.

groupHasLeader.description: If false, no leader is set for the group and nobody can sign up.

groupIsActive.description: If false, the group is not in active state and nobody can sign up.

groupIsNotFull.description: If false, the group's max number of members is reached and nobody can sign up.

groupIsNotHidden.description: If false, the group is set to hidden and nobody can sign up.

groupIsOpenForMembers.description: If false, the group is not set to be open for members and nobody can sign up.

groupIsPublic.description: If false, the group is not public and only users already signed in are allowed to sign up.

newPersonDepartmentIsSet.description: If false, the default department for new users is not set. When persons without an account attempt to sign up, no new user accounts will be created but the group leader will be requested by mail.

newPersonStationIsSet.description: If false, the default station for new users is not set. When persons without an account attempt to sign up, no new user accounts will be created but the group leader will be requested by mail.

newPersonStatusIsSet.description: If false, the default status for new users is not set. When persons without an account attempt to sign up, no new user accounts will be created but the group leader will be requested by mail.

rolesSetInGroup.description: If false, the standard role and requester role are not set for the group and nobody can sign up.

signUpHeadline.description: Text which can be displayed as a headline for the sign up section

signUpPersons.description: Lists all persons the current user is allowed to sign up for. This includes spouses, children below the age of 16 and all persons with the same email address.

status.description: Specifies whether this person is already in the group (IN_GROUP), in pending state for the group (REQUESTED), or selected by the user to be added into the group (CLICKED). Otherwise NOT_CLICKED.

group.title: PublicGroup

requesterId.description: If the user is signed in, this specifies the user ID of the requester.

status.description: Specifies whether this person is already in the group (IN_GROUP), in pending state for the group (REQUESTED), or selected by the user to be added into the group (CLICKED). Otherwise NOT_CLICKED.

post.description: To sign a user up into a group, the form data has to be send to this endpoint.

parameters.description: Group ID of the public group
parameters.name: groupId

forms.description: A list of form data containing a form object for each person that should be signed up.

form.description: The form data for the current person.

id.description: ID of the form field as returned from /publicgroups/{groupId}/form

type.description: Type of the form field as returned from /publicgroups/{groupId}/form (should be one of: person, custom, relation, privacy, comment)

personId.description: The person ID the current form applies to. Can be empty if a single new user is about to sign up.

signOutUrlTemplate.description: Url used in the mail sent to the user.

post.summary: Send a Sign Up Form to Get Signed Up into a Public Group

post.description: The sign up token is needed to sign up to a public or open group using the form. The token can be issued by person id or for an email. If the person id is given, the token and the form url is returned. If an eMail address is given, the system checks if a user exists with that eMail, if s/he is already in the group or if the eMail is new to the system, hence a new user account would be necessary. The mail is sent with detailed information and a link to the sign up form.

clicked.description:
Array of person ids, which are clicked on group detail page. Those persons, will be also checked on the form site.
The `clicked` field will be saved only in combination with `personId`.

email.description: eMail address of not logged in user or new user.

groupHomepageHash.description: The hash of the group homepage. If specified, the user can return to the group homepage after the sign up was successful.

personId.description: Person Id, which issues the token.

signUpUrlTemplate.description: Url used in the mail sent to the user.

requestBody.description: You MUST provide either `personId` OR `email`. Both fields cannot be present at the same time.

data.success: Token successfully created. Mail sent with link.

value.translatedMessage: Die eingegebenen Daten waren nicht korrekt.

post.description:
ChurchTools utilizes a queueing system to offload time-intensive or processing-intensive work. Calling this endpoint will start a worker, which grabs pending jobs and processing them. If the queue has still jobs pending the worker starts a new worker to continue the work.

Existing Queues:

* `default`

get.description:
Job in a queue can belong to a job group to categorize a job. This endpoint counts jobs in queue and groups them by they status.

Use this endpoint to check if all jobs are processed or if still jobs are pending and wait to be processed.

parameters.description: Limit result to this job group.
parameters.name: job_groups

deleted.description: Number of Deleted Jobs (but still in Queue listed)

name.description: Name of Job Group. `__single__` is For Jobs Which don't Belong to a Group

total.description: Total Jobs in Queue of This Job Group

get.summary: Status Information About Job Groups in Queue

data.description: Gemeinsam Kirche gestalten.

items.author: Hans-Helge Bürger
items.content: Der Juli ist da – wie wunderbar. Denn das heißt, wir haben eine neue App-Version für euch und dieses Mal mit einer Funktion, die von vielen gewünscht wurde: dem Kalender.
items.description: Wir haben eine Lizenzänderung vorgenommen, die den ChurchTools Sync betrifft. Ab sofort sind nicht mehr Aufträge, sondern Verbindungen lizenzrelevant. Die Entwicklung des Sync geht weiter. So könnt ihr neben Personen bald auch Finanz-Buchungen aus Optigem synchronisieren. Durch die neuen Möglichkeiten,
items.title: Lizenzänderung: Mehr aus dem Sync herausholen!
